intro: Myristica duplopunctata subsp. versteeghii, commonly known as the Malabar nut or Malabar pepper, is a member of the Myristicaceae family and is native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a small evergreen tree that produces distinctive red, fleshy fruits containing a single seed. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, resinous bark and leaves with a strong, spicy scent. It thrives in tropical climates with high humidity and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its unique flavor and medicinal properties, it has been traditionally used in local cuisines and herbal remedies.
